messages.message:
Just off the phone with the CIO at Cass who said ‘i’ve been spending more time on AI Hub than doing my actual job the last few days’. He’s coming up with lots of use cases i’ve never thought of!

There were a few things I noticed as he was moving about the platform that I think we need to fix. Some also came from his comment about not understand what was on front of him that we could improve.

It wasn’t immediately clear that these were suggestions that he could click on. He thought these were fields that had already been configured.

I think it might make sense to show these when you click on the ‘add field’ button as you’ve then shown that your intent is to add a new field
He’s asked for XML, and we don’t format this properly at the moment in the response, quite often it says ‘I can’t do that i’m a language model’ when you ask about XML
We’ve got an unecessary scroll bar for the whole page when on windows.

When the run of his app completed, it wasn’t obvious to him that you click on the run ID to get the results. He expected the completed word to be clickable, or there to be a button near it he could click.

When in converse, if you type a question and then leave the focus of the text box, you can’t click the send button. He thought he’d broken something as it was greyed out until he refocused back on the chat box

He forgot he had advanced turned on. I think it would help if we did something to the chat box (change the colour or something) to make it clear what you are doing is expensive and to not forget the setting you’ve chosen.
This is great feedback, thank you!!
